# unhideRows(at:withAnimation:)

**Instance Method**

Unhides the specified table rows.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func unhideRows(at indexes: IndexSet, withAnimation rowAnimation: NSTableView.AnimationOptions = [])
```

## Parameters

- **indexes**: An index set containing indexes of the hidden rows to be shown again.
- **rowAnimation**: An animation effect to be applied when the rows are hidden.

## Discussion

Unhiding a table row causes the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableViewDelegate/tableView(_:didAdd:forRow:)] delegate method to be invoked.

## Related Documentation

- **NSTableView.AnimationOptions**: Specifies the animation effects to apply when inserting or removing rows.
- **tableView(_:didAdd:forRow:)**: Tells the delegate that a row view was added at the specified row.

## Hiding and Showing Table Rows

- **hideRows(at:withAnimation:)**: Hides the specified table rows.
- **hiddenRowIndexes**: The indexes of all hidden table rows.
